metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31810 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Ruby through 2.6.7, 2.7.x through 2.7.3, and 3.x through 3.0.1. A malicious FTP server can use the PASV response to trick Net::FTP into connecting back to a given IP address and port. This potentially makes curl extract information about services that are otherwise private and not disclosed (e.g., the attacker can conduct port scans and service banner extractions).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm1
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm1
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> for xenial, the backport can be kind of intrusive. for now ignoring it.

criterions.comment: ruby2.3 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.16+esm1').
